com.tinfoil.sms.crypto

Class Encryption

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinfoil.sms.crypto.Encryption

  • public class Encryption
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which operates as a facade to greatly simplify the underlying complexity required to encrypt/decrypt messages using Elliptic Curve Cryptography.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static int COUNT_SIZE 
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Long,com.tinfoilsms.crypto.ECEngine> decryptMap

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Encryption()
      The basic constructor, initializes the encrypt/decrypt hash maps.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private byte[] addCounter(byte[] message, java.lang.Integer counter)
      Prefixes the message count to the beginning of the message that is to be encrypted
      java.lang.String decrypt(Number number, java.lang.String message)
      Decrypts the message provided using the public key belonging to the number and adds a 32 byte verification signature (HMAC) to the message.
      java.lang.String encrypt(Number number, java.lang.String message)
      Encrypts the message provided using the public key belonging to the number and adds a 32 byte verification signature (HMAC) to the message.
      private java.lang.Integer getCounter(byte[] message)
      Gets the prefixed message count from the message received
      private void initECEngine(Number number, boolean mode)
      Initializes the encryption engine given the number, which contains the public key, shared apriori info, and nonces, unique to that number, which is needed to initialize the encryption engine.

    • Constructor Detail

        public Encryption()

    • Method Detail

      • encrypt

        public java.lang.String encrypt(Number number,
                       java.lang.String message)
                         throws org.spongycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException
        Encrypts the message provided using the public key belonging to the number and adds a 32 byte verification signature (HMAC) to the message.
        Parameters:
        number - The number that the message is to be encrypted for
        message - The plaintext message to encrypt
        Returns:
        The ciphertext of the encrypted message
        Throws:
        org.spongycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException - If an error occurs attempting to encrypt the message.

      • decrypt

        public java.lang.String decrypt(Number number,
                       java.lang.String message)
                         throws org.spongycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException
        Decrypts the message provided using the public key belonging to the number and adds a 32 byte verification signature (HMAC) to the message.
        Parameters:
        number - The number that the message is to be decrypted for
        message - The ciphertext message to decrypt
        Returns:
        The plaintext of the decrypted message
        Throws:
        org.spongycastle.crypto.InvalidCipherTextException - If an error occurs attempting to encrypt the message.

      • initECEngine

        private void initECEngine(Number number,
                boolean mode)
        Initializes the encryption engine given the number, which contains the public key, shared apriori info, and nonces, unique to that number, which is needed to initialize the encryption engine.
        Parameters:
        number - The number, which contains the cryptographic info
        mode - The mode to initialize the engine as, true for encryption and false for decryption mode.

      • addCounter

        private byte[] addCounter(byte[] message,
                java.lang.Integer counter)
        Prefixes the message count to the beginning of the message that is to be encrypted
        Parameters:
        message - The message to prefix the counter to
        Returns:
        The message with the counter value prefixed

      • getCounter

        private java.lang.Integer getCounter(byte[] message)
        Gets the prefixed message count from the message received
        Parameters:
        message - The message received to get the prefixed counter from
        Returns:
        The counter value
